page.title: 04CHURCH FENTON O.A.P.'S VIEWS
page.content: We interviewed several old people in Church Fenton to find out what they felt about village life for the over 60's in 1985. 1.All were born here or moved here to get married or work on the railway,Firth Blakleys engineering or R.A.F.base. 2.They have help from home helps and go regularly to the over 60's club. 3.Their days are spent meeting friends for a chat on the bench next to the school,walking the many paths or watching T.V. 4.They purchase their groceries from the village shop and occasionally go by bus to Sherburn or York for special things. 5.They say the village is a friendly place apart from the noise of the R.A.F. planes which living there they get used to but still dislike.
